titleInfo.title: 'Note on the Christian Communities in and around Mesopotamia'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: The foliation for this sequence commences at folio 148, and terminates at folio 148, as it is part of a larger physical volume; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between folios 7-153 of the volume; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and can be found in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: This printed report by the Political Department of the India Office concerns the Christian communities of Mesopotamia. The report is divided into the following sections: A: Groups; B: Millets; C: Geographical Position; D: History and Tenets; E: Assyrian Refugees; and F: The Millet that chiefly concerns His Majesty's Government. Christian groups covered in the report include: Gregorians, Nestorians or East Syrians, Jacobites or West Syrians, Armenian Uniates, Chaldeans (East Syrian Uniates), Jacobite Uniates (West Syrian Uniates, officially called Syrian Catholics), and Maronites.
